page.title: 05Clipstone Colliery
page.content: 1134 people work underground. Approximately 200 people work on the surface.1,000,000 tonnes of coal is produced each year.Headstock number one is 220 feet tall and headstock number two is 215 feet tall.The colliery is 63 years old.The depths of the present faces are:- low main 840m deep soft 780m and yard 910m. The working faces extend 3 miles north west and three miles south east from the colliery.Industrial grades and domestic house coalis mined to be converted into Sunbrite Doubles and coalite smokeless fuels. It is converted from coal to coke at Avenue Coke Ovens,Wingerworth,Derbyshire,and at the Coalite Plant,Bolsover, Derbyshire.The solid waste tips are 1200m away.Liquid waste is pumped into a lagoon dirt tip.Coal is transported by rail and lorry.The pit costs
